intro: Aquilegia arbascensis, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with palmate leaves divided into five to seven lobes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aquilegia arbascensis is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
